epa09087303 A man locks the North Korean embassy gate while police officers guard him, in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 21 March 2021. According to a North Korean goverrnment report, the North Korean regime vowed to cut ties with Malaysia, after authorities in Malaysia's high court ruled that a North Korean citizen should be extradicted to the USA. The man, named Mun Chol Myong, was arrested on 13 May 2019 after US authorities requested his extradition, on money laundering charges.                      <path d="M33.656 40.357l-1.228-9.62C32.008 27.44 29.197 25 25.865 25H16.81c-3.331 0-6.143 2.439-6.563 5.737L9.02 40.375c-.085.674.123 1.522.572 2.03.45.509 1.098.97 1.777.97h19.938c.68 0 1.327-.47 1.778-.98.45-.51.658-1.363.572-2.038z" data-v-22ae94a0="" fill="#D7D7D7" fill-rule="nonzero" mask="url(#b)">

                        <!-- -->

                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="article__summary summary" data-v-196d996b="">
                       <ul class="article-level-five__summary--ul content--ul" data-v-0497706c="" data-v-196d996b="" index="0">
                        <li class="article-level-five__summary--li content--li" data-v-0497706c="">
                         The two sides have agreed to work together to fight climate change, but the prospect of Xi Jinping and Joe Biden meeting face-to-face appears remote for now
                        </li>
                        <li class="article-level-five__summary--li content--li" data-v-0497706c="">
                         The US is pushing for concessions over Hong Kong, Xinjiang and Taiwan – but Beijing insists it will not back down on these issues
                        </li>
                       </ul>

                      <svg class="status-left__video--desktop" data-v-22ae94a0="" data-v-5da217ed="" height="9" viewbox="0 0 14 9" width="14" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                       <path d="M10.889 3.375V.75c0-.412-.35-.75-.778-.75H.778C.35 0 0 .338 0 .75v7.5c0 .412.35.75.778.75h9.333c.428 0 .778-.338.778-.75V5.625l3.111 3V.375l-3.111 3z" data-v-22ae94a0="" fill="#D7D7D7">

                       <a class="article-title__article-link article-hover-link" data-v-196d996b="" data-v-22ae94a0="" href="/comment/opinion/article/3126216/climate-debate-must-confront-burning-coal-issues-or-risk">
                        <span data-v-196d996b="">
                         <span class="article__article-type article-type article__article-type--opinion" data-v-196d996b="">
                          Macroscope |
                         </span>
                        </span>
                        Climate debate must confront burning coal issues or risk utter failure
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="article__summary summary" data-v-196d996b="">
                       <p class="article-level-five__summary--p content--p" data-v-0497706c="" data-v-196d996b="" index="0">
                        Big Coal polluters are increasing investment in coal-fired power stations despite public pledges to the contrary. Vast sums spent on counteracting global warming would be better invested in technology to capture carbon at source, before it enters the atmosphere.
                       </p>
                      </div>

                   <div class="article-level article-level-ten article content__article-level article-level opinion--default align--bottom" columnist="" data-v-0669c21a="" data-v-110c105c="" icontype="" topic="[object Object]">
                    <div class="article__inner" data-v-110c105c="">
                     <div class="article__main" data-v-110c105c="">
                      <div class="article__title" data-v-110c105c="">
                       <a class="article__link" data-v-110c105c="" data-v-22ae94a0="" href="/comment/opinion/article/3126160/hong-kong-election-reform-missed-chances-shape-citys-future-must">
                        <span data-v-110c105c="">
                         <span class="article__article-type article__article-type--opinion" data-v-110c105c="">
                          Opinion |
                         </span>
                        </span>
                        Missed chances to shape Hong Kong’s political future must not be repeated
                       </a>
                      </div>
                      <div class="article__summary summary" data-v-110c105c="">
                       <p class="article-level-ten__summary--p content--p" data-v-0497706c="" data-v-110c105c="" index="0">
                        Beijing has lost patience and thrown out much of our political structure, a setback for the democratisation of Hong Kong. Those who still wish to remain involved in civic affairs need more transparency and information from officials.
                       </p>
                      </div>
